workflow.name: AI email reply based on HubSpot data + Slack approval
workflow.description:
This n8n template drafts customer-ready email replies using Google Gemini, enriched with HubSpot context (contact, deals, companies, tickets). Each draft is routed to Slack for one-click approval before it‚Äôs sent from Gmail‚Äîso you move fast without losing control.

Ideal for support and sales teams that want speedy, personalized responses while keeping humans in the loop.

---

## How it works

* **Gmail Trigger** watches for new inbound emails.
* **Sender filter** excludes internal domains (e.g., `n8n.io`) to avoid auto-replying to teammates.
* **HubSpot contact lookup** finds the sender and fetches associated **deals/companies/tickets** via association + batch read.
* **CRM context is normalized** into clean, LLM-friendly fields (no IDs or sensitive noise).
* **Gemini (Google AI Studio)** generates a concise, friendly reply using:

  * Sender name, subject, and message snippet
  * Safe, relevant HubSpot context (e.g., top 1‚Äì2 deals or an open ticket)
  * Style constraints (‚â§ \~150 words, single CTA, optional clarifying question)
* **Slack approval** posts the draft to a channel; if **approved**, n8n **replies via Gmail** in the original thread.

---

## How to use

1. **Gmail:** Connect the same account for the trigger and reply nodes.
2. **HubSpot:** Connect OAuth on the search + HTTP request nodes.
3. **Gemini:** Add your **Google AI Studio** API key to the **Google Gemini Chat Model** node.
4. **Slack:** Connect and select the channel for draft approvals.
5. (Optional) **Filter:** Adjust the Allowed Sender filter before going live.
6. (Optional) **Prompt:** Edit ‚ÄúDraft Reply (AI Agent)‚Äù tone/length or how much CRM detail to include.
7. Activate the workflow. New emails will produce Slack-approved replies automatically.

---

## Requirements

* **Gmail** (trigger + send)
* **HubSpot** (OAuth2) for contact + associations
* **Slack** for approval step
* **Google Gemini** (Google AI Studio API key)

---

## Notes & customization

* **Safety rails:** The prompt avoids exposing IDs/raw JSON and caps CRM details to what‚Äôs useful.
* **Auto-send mode:** Skip Slack if you want fully automated replies for specific senders/labels.
* **Richer context:** Extend the batch read to pull more properties (e.g., next step, renewal date).
* **Triage:** Branch on subject/labels to route billing vs. technical requests to different prompts.
* **QA queue:** If the model asks a clarifying question, keep it to **one**‚Äîthe node enforces that.

workflow.name: AI email reply based on HubSpot data + Slack approval

parameters.text:
=You are a helpful, concise customer support/sales assistant. Draft a ready-to-send email reply.

DO NOT output JSON, arrays, or anything under CONTEXT. Only output the email.

# INPUTS

My name (for signature): John Bolton
From: {{$('Watch Gmail (New Inbound)').first().json.From}}
Subject: {{$('Watch Gmail (New Inbound)').first().json.Subject}}
Customer message:
{{$('Watch Gmail (New Inbound)').first().json.snippet}}

# CONTEXT (do not quote or restate; summarize only if helpful)
Contact (HubSpot JSON):
{{ JSON.stringify($('Find Contact by Email').first().json.properties || {}, null, 2) }}

Companies (JSON, may be empty):
{{ JSON.stringify($json.companies || []) }}

Deals (JSON, may be empty):
{{ JSON.stringify($json.deals || []) }}

Tickets (JSON, may be empty):
{{ JSON.stringify($json.tickets || []) }}

# WHAT TO DO
- Acknowledge the sender and the exact topic in the Subject/body.
- Answer their request directly and succinctly.
- Offer 1‚Äì2 clear next steps or a single CTA.
- Personalize using safe context only:
  - Use contact name/company if present.
  - If deals exist, mention at most the 1‚Äì2 most relevant (name, stage, amount, close date). Ignore IDs/owner/pipeline/internal fields.
  - If tickets exist, reference subject/status briefly if relevant.
- If context is missing, write a generic but professional reply (do not invent facts).

# TONE
Friendly, professional, plain language. Short paragraphs or brief bullets.

# OUTPUT FORMAT (no extra commentary, no subject, just the email body)
- Greeting with the person‚Äôs name if available.
- 2‚Äì5 sentences answering the question; bullets allowed for steps.
- Optional one-line context (deal/ticket) if helpful.
- One clear CTA.
- Polite sign-off with a sender name placeholder.

# CONSTRAINTS
- Never expose IDs, raw JSON, or internal property names.
- Keep under ~150 words unless necessary.
- If anything is unclear, end with exactly one clarifying question.

Generate the reply now.

parameters.content:
## Get CRM information
Fetch contact info and associated deals, tickets and compaines.
## Wait for You to Approve in Slack, and reply in Gmail

## AI email reply with HubSpot context + Slack approval

### How it works
1. A new Gmail email triggers the workflow.
2. The sender‚Äôs HubSpot info (deals, companies, tickets) is fetched.
3. Gemini drafts a personalized reply.
4.The draft appears in Slack for quick review and approval.
5. After approval, the reply is sent automatically.

### Setup
- [ ] **Gmail:** Use the same account for the trigger and the send nodes.
- [ ] **HubSpot:** Connect all the HubSpot nodes.
- [ ] **Slack:** Connect Slack and choose where to send the draft for approval.
- [ ] **Gemini:** Add your [Google AI Studio](https://aistudio.google.com/) API key
- [ ] **Filter:** Tweak or remove the sender rule before going live.

### Customize
- **Prompt:** Adjust tone, length, and how much CRM detail to include.
- **Fields:** Pick which deal/company/ticket properties to pull.
- **Approval:** Skip Slack to auto-send, or add extra reviewers if needed.
- **Filter** for specific Gmail tags or emails

json.Subject: Hey
json.snippet: I forgot what I last ordered. Can you help me? Sent from Proton Mail Android

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.

data.details: The Code node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow.

The Filter node can be used to filter items based on a condition. If the condition is met, the item will be passed on to the next node. If the condition is not met, the item will be omitted. Conditions can be combined together by AND(meet all conditions), or OR(meet at least one condition).
